alert.note: Alert for Gila; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 7:37PM MST until July 24 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR THE WHITE MOUNTAIN APACHE RESERVATION... At 732 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms weakening across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cedar Creek, Carrizo, and the White Mountain Apache Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 73 between mile markers 311 and 323. Highway 60 between mile markers 311 and 330. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Forestdale Creek, Cedar Creek, Turkey Canyon, West Cedar Creek, Carrizo Creek, East Cedar Creek, Corduroy Creek, Red Canyon, Amos Wash, and Deer Spring Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
